results.title: Social Media Manager
results.description:
ABOUT HAPPITY:

Happity is a family friendly startup with a big mission! We're looking for a dynamic Social Media Manager to join our journey, helping new parents escape loneliness - especially on those long days spent as sole carer. We help parents connect in their communities by finding baby & toddler groups in their local area. This is a great time to join us as we expand across the UK!

We are a small team who are passionate about the work we do to end loneliness in new parents and we are proud of our achievements with our products. We have seen huge growth in the last year and currently have over 1m website users a year, approaching 100k parents subscribers to our mailing list, and over 26k active classes.

We work remotely and flexibly and this important new role will help us take Happity's marketing to the next level, bringing Happity to a wider national audience.  

If you have proven experience growing social media followings, are creative, innovative, detail driven and experienced in reporting then we want to hear from you! 

 

ABOUT YOU:

As you'll be working in a remote team, you'll need to be very self-motivated, able to manage your own time and an exceptional communicator! You'll also need to be available some weekends and evenings for engagement on posts.

You're someone who loves what Happity is about, you share our mission and want to make a positive difference in the world. You have a passion for helping us to grow as a brand.

You'll already have experience of growing a social media audience under your belt - whether that's been in a work capacity or other environment (such as voluntary or personal projects).

You don't need to be a parent to apply for this role, but you do need to demonstrate a sound knowledge of the market for baby & toddler classes - and in particular, what kind of content would appeal to an audience of new parents!

 

WHAT THE ROLE INVOLVES:

You will manage our social media presence, be responsible for generating content for social media, website, brand assets, advertising and more so that we can improve our brand awareness, customer responsiveness and ultimately make an even greater impact with our product.

The main responsibilities of this role include: 

  • Creating a social media content strategy to fit within our marketing strategy
  • Creating, scheduling and engaging on posts and stories (currently on Instagram and Facebook)
  • Managing our Facebook Group to build community
  • Reporting on progress and improving strategy
  • Supporting or managing campaigns

It may also include:

  • Blog, Website and Advertising creation
  • Assisting with PR and other marketing tasks including engaging with influencers

 

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

What we're hoping to see highlighted on your CV and application:

Essential:

  • Social Media Strategy & Management - to be able to deliver on Happity's commercial and impact-driven goals. You'll be responsible for managing our online community of providers and parents, analysing and reporting social media activity (this should be using software such as Later or Buffer.) Reporting is across all channels - on acquisition, engagement, top-performing content etc. You would attend and contribute to monthly marketing meetings to shape the marketing strategy for the brand, discuss and review upcoming content, and review marketing campaigns.
  • Design - you will also have some experience with design software such as Canva, have an eye for design and fantastic attention to detail, being comfortable to edit, repurpose and create imagery, graphics and video / animations for use across our channels
  • Startup mentality: While we're an established, scaling organisation, we work very much like a lean, agile startup. You need to be great at prioritising (and knowing which corners to cut) - and working closely with a tight-knit, small team.
  • Passion for social media: You need to have in-depth knowledge of social media channels and a proven track record of creating and sustaining online communities. 
  • Creativity: We are looking for a person with loads of creativity and new ideas to improve our content, whether written, image or video. You will have fantastic copy-writing skills across both short-form (social media posts, ad copy etc) and long-form content (blogs, articles, press releases) and lots of good ideas! We are looking for someone with excellent written and verbal English language skills for the position. 
  • Analytical, customer-driven mindset: You're able to use your analytical brain to spot trends and identify opportunities for future activity. Alongside this you will be involved in analysing the SEO performance of our website content, identifying relevant keywords and ensuring our content targets those effectively.
  • Ability to learn new tools: You must be able to learn how to use new marketing tools with ease. Experience with HTML and website Content Management Systems as well as experience using email service providers (we use Active Campaign and Mailerlite currently) and CRM systems is a strong plus, but not a requirement for the job.
  • Purpose driven: We're making real social impact. We truly believe in what we're doing and want you to be part of that. 

Desirable:

  • You have experience managing paid advertising (Facebook, Google etc.)
  • You have good knowledge of site analytics tools (Google Analytics)
  • You have experience in PR and Partnerships
  • You have experience growing early-stage companies to post Series A in the consumer space
  • You have experience in a parenting company or digital solutions

 

All applicants should mention the word "Firework" to show they've read the requirements ;-)

 

Benefits and reasons why the role might appeal:

  • Work closely with the Founders of a purpose-led, exciting and fast-growing parentings brand
  • Join a friendly and fun marketing team made up of a mix of freelancers and part-time employees
  • Opportunity to provide key strategic input to key marketing and business strategies
  • Opportunity to work remotely and flexible, with unlimited holiday
  • Growth opportunity: as Happity grows there will be opportunity for the role to further expand 

 

HOW TO APPLY

If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career in a socially-motivated, and growing business then please apply today by submitting your CV along with a cover letter outlining:

  • Why Happity?
  • Why this role?
  • Why you?
  • Example of relevant previous work

 

HOURS & COMPENSATION

Hours: 15-18 hours per week initially with potential to grow if suitable

Pay: £15-18 per hour depending on experience

Closing Date: 31st Jan 2023 with rolling interviews so the position may be filled sooner.

Happity is an equal opportunity employer and all applicants will be considered for employment regardless of ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or disability status.

results.title: Marketing Designer
results.description:
About Ergeon

We are disrupting the trillion-dollar construction industry with technology, making it possible for almost any profession to operate remotely. Our company is the only startup combining the strengths of technology and remote work to solve the challenges of residential construction. 

Unlike most other products and services, hiring a contractor for a home improvement project is very far from a 1-click experience today. Ergeon aims to empower skilled local contractors with human and technology-powered services to make home improvement easy. We take a full-stack approach to create a seamless experience for homeowners, and leverage technology to scale the front & back offices of contractors.

With the belief that everyone has a right to professional growth and respect regardless of their location, we proudly have staff (aka Ergeoneers) in over 40 countries, with a great score and recommendation rating on Glassdoor. Come join us to make construction friendly and accessible!

 

Ergeon: [er - g- eon]

Erg = unit of work or energy

Eon = billion years

 

Ergeon is founded by CS Ph.D. serial entrepreneurs Jiayue (Jenny) He and Odysseas Tstatalos. They picked this name to symbolize their joint passion for using tech to revolutionize work. 

 
Overview of the Role

A Marketing Designer at Ergeon is a specialist in graphic design. You will bring the marketing vision to life.

As a designer, you will consider Ergeon’s brand to ensure that the outputs are in line with our brand identity.  The role asks that you use illustration, composition, color and images to create digital and print collateral.

Responsibilities
  • Design layouts for brochures, flyers, postcards.
  • Design/develop collateral marketing materials for direct mail, flyers, brochures, signage 
  • Design/develop collateral for emails, blog posts, landing pages, online promotions and website pages
  • Create promotional advertisements for social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, etc.
Desired Skills and Experience
Must have
  • 2+ years of experience as a designer
  • Post-secondary education, Bachelor's degree or higher
  • Strong print and layout design ability/fundamentals, understands the brief and execute
  • Artistic, analytical
  • Uses software like Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator
  • Uses google suites, primarily google docs
  • Work independently and efficiently
Nice to have
  • Experience with digital marketing/advertising
  • Experience with inDesign and/or Figma
  • HTML coding

 

Technical Requirements

Good Laptop setup with Chrome browser

  • Minimum of 8GB RAM
  • Minimum processor:
    • For Intel variants of CPUs:
      • Core i3 8000 Series (8th Gen) or higher
      • Pentium N5000 series (Quad-core variant) or higher
      • Celeron J5000 series or higher (quad-core variant)
    • For AMD variants of CPUs:
      • Ryzen 3, 3rd generation or higher

 

Stable high-speed internet connection

  • At least 5mbps upload and 20 Mbps download

 

Headset

  • With a noise cancelling microphone

 

Power backup

  • 250-300W UPS

 

Data availability

  • Ability to access up to 1.5GB of data per day during storm outages
 
Compensation

Hourly rate between $12.5 - $14.5 USD, depending on experience and location.

  • Your final compensation will depend on your placement on our Career Ladder and will be calculated hourly.
  • You'll be paid weekly through Upwork (www.upwork.com), the platform we choose to hire and pay our Ergeoneers all over the world.
 
Additional important information

 

Availability
  • This position is part-time with expectations of at least 20 hours per week.
 
Ergeon’s benefits and perks for full staff members

Competitive compensation: We invest in people! We are constantly doing worldwide market research in order to offer globally competitive salaries. And we are well funded by VCs.

  All-Remote since the beginning: We have a diverse team spread across 40+ countries. We stay connected through the best remote work practices such as flexible work hours, team events, remote happy hours, and by sharing our love of food!

    Tech, Wellness & Learning fund: You can have a $400USD bonus per year for software and hardware tools, workplace improvements, fitness-related spending (includes things like yoga classes, Fitbit tracker, new running shoes, gym membership. . .), and books, courses, training, or even attending conferences.

  Stock options: All staff is eligible after 6 months of full-time work.

  Birthday Paid day off: You can take the exact day, or Friday before if it is on a weekend!

  Flexible Paid time off: You can take 12 days after working 6 months, PLUS 2 extra days per year for a maximum of 20 days.

  Free Headset Benefit: You can get a noise-canceling headset since your first day working full-time.

  Equipment: Laptop replacement after 1 year of full-time work. And every 3 years after that.

   Co-Working Fund: Meet in groups of 3+ Ergeon friends and get reimbursed up to USD $20 for coffee, co-working, etc (once per quarter).

  Language Classes: here at Ergeon you will have the opportunity to learn or improve a language!

 

We believe everyone has a right to professional growth and respect, no matter their location.

Ergeon’s workforce is given meaningful opportunities and is supported by a kind and diverse community.

Our global staff (Ergeoneers) have access to career growth, amazing work culture, and great benefits.

 

Come join us to transform the construction industry!

results.title: Virtual IP Litigation Paralegal
results.description:
Equivity is looking for a part-time virtual paralegal with recent experience supporting attorneys in intellectual property litigation firms. We are looking for paralegals with at least three years of experience in intellectual property litigation, including patent and trademark litigation. The ideal candidate will have experience supporting attorneys who handle Inter Partes Reviews before the Patent Office. If you have experience supporting IP litigation attorneys as a paralegal, and have previously worked in a virtual environment, we want to hear from you!

Virtual paralegals at Equivity develop a portfolio of clients and support a number of different attorneys. We are currently seeking a virtual paralegal to support attorneys in intellectual property litigation law practices. You would assist in preparing pleadings, including complaints, motions, and all necessary supporting documents.  Your experience with discovery should include preparation of written discovery, responses to written discovery, and collection of the underlying documentation.  You should be well versed with electronic discovery, including searching for responsive documents, reviewing and tagging documents using appropriate software, and producing documents.  You should also have experience with the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, performing legal research by utilizing Westlaw or Lexis (including Sherardizing), and cite checking. You should have experience supporting attorneys through all aspects of litigation, from initiation of a suit through trial. 

The ideal candidate would have experience supporting attorneys who handle Inter Partes Reviews before the PTAB. Helpful experience would include assistance in preparing petitions, motions, oppositions, and declarations.

Candidates should be experienced with litigation in federal courts, the Federal Circuit, and PTAB. Familiarity with PTAB and state court proceedings would also be an asset.


More about our company:

Equivity matches clients with virtual assistants that provide long-term paralegal, administrative and marketing support.  Our virtual paralegals work with a high degree of autonomy and are responsible for developing lasting relationships with our clients. Because we provide an extremely attentive service to our clients, you must be available to respond to client communications throughout the business day (Monday through Friday, 9am – 6pm Eastern or Pacific Time Zone) within one hour by email, phone, and text. You should also be available to complete tasks and work on projects during the business day. All of this work is done remotely, meaning that you can work from home.  

The selected candidate would be hired as a part-time employee (W2) of Equivity, not an independent contractor (1099). We are looking for somebody who has at least 20 hours per week of availability, and the starting pay is $22 per hour. We are a growing business and are looking for a virtual paralegal who is excited to partner with us and is interested in a long-term role with our company.   

Qualities we are looking for:
  • Organization
  • Dedication
  • Initiative
  • Reliability
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Resourcefulness
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Responsiveness
  • Technologically savvy
  • Ability to work independently with limited oversight


Equivity is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. Equivity is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Equivity are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national original, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender orientation, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Equivity will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

Position Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 3+ years of recent experience working as a paralegal supporting IP litigation firms experience preparing pleadings, including motions, complaints, and answers
  • Experience preparing written discovery and responses to written discovery
  • Experience with electronic discovery, including searching for responsive documents, reviewing and tagging documents using appropriate software, and producing documents
  • Proficiency with the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, performing legal research by utilizing Westlaw or Lexis (including Shepardizing), and cite checking
  • Excellent writing skills and strong attention to detail
  • Experience drafting from templates as well as from software that provides electronic forms
  • Availability to respond to requests within an hour during the hours of 9 AM - 6 PM, Monday – Friday Eastern or Pacific time
  • Your own laptop and smart phone with broadband access to Internet
  • Quiet location in which to make and take phone calls

Helpful experience:

  • Experience with interpartes proceedings, including assisting attorneys preparing petitions, motions, oppositions, and declarations

results.title: Web3 People Operations Coordinator
results.description:
We are ClubRare - The World's first community-centered Physical NFT marketplace for collectors. We connect the Real-world and the Metaverse. We are a community for people who trade the things we love.

We are a fully remote company with no fixed headquarters. As a distributed company, we embrace a diverse and inclusive culture that transcends geographical borders. Our team members come from all over the world and bring a rich array of experiences, perspectives, and lifestyles to the team. We believe that this diversity enhances our creativity, collaboration, and innovation, and enables us to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.

We are deeply committed to fostering a culture of empathy, integrity, strategic thinking, innovation, leadership, and performance. These values drive everything we do, from the way we interact with our customers and partners, to the way we develop and deliver our products and services. It's our shared values that give us the strength and drive to become the open metaverse for collectors.

What’s in It for You?

  • Be a vital member of a cutting-edge project and take your career to the next level.
  • Work from anywhere, on your own schedule, and be part of a team that shares your values and has a clear vision.
  • Have the chance to shape the future of an innovative new model for cryptocurrency and blockchain applications.
  • Get hands-on experience with the latest tech and systems, and challenge yourself to learn and grow.
  • Play an active role in one of the most significant technological innovations in human history.
  • Be compensated with a competitive salary paid in crypto for your dedication and efforts.

Your Impact

In this role, you will have the opportunity to get involved in all aspects of People Operations and will play a crucial role in supporting the growth and development of the organization.

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, a proactive and hands-on approach, attention to detail, and a passion for learning about and staying up-to-date on the latest trends in Web3 and NFTs. This is a part-time role with the potential to transition to a full-time position in the future. If you are a motivated and organized individual with a keen interest in the intersection of technology and HR, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

As a People Operations Coordinator, your responsibilities will include:

  • Designing and implementing processes such as onboarding, employee and manager feedback cycles, recruiting, and interviewing.
  • Developing and continuously improving HR policies and processes, including tools/systems and operational guides.
  • Taking ownership of employee queries and using critical thinking to identify and resolve root causes.
  • Documenting and maintaining process procedures for the People Operations team and creating self-service resources for all employees.
  • Managing semi-monthly and monthly payrolls accurately and efficiently.
  • Working with a high level of autonomy and cross-functionally to ensure all employees have the support and resources they need to succeed.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in People Operations, with a track record of success in supporting and scaling HR and Recruiting functions and processes.
  • A demonstrated passion for staying at the forefront of technology and innovation, with a minimum of 1 year of experience in a Web3 or start-up company.
  • Excellent English language skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with employees at all levels of the organization.
  • A proactive, "can-do" attitude and a willingness to take on new challenges.
  • Experience working with high-performing teams and a track record of contributing to team success.
  • A tech-savvy mindset and attention to detail, with the ability to navigate and adapt to new systems and tools.
  • The ability to handle sensitive and critical information, conversations, and situations with compassion and discretion.

Discover more about ClubRare and what we stand for by visiting our website at www.clubrare.xyz


We are committed to creating a work environment that is inclusive and welcoming to all. As an equal-opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristic. We believe that diversity is a source of strength and all qualified candidates will be given equal consideration for employment at ClubRare.

results.title: People Ops Assistant
results.description:
About ZigZag Global

If you’ve made an online return with Zara, Selfridges or boohoo there’s a good chance you’ve already been introduced to our award-winning SaaS platform. We’re an eCommerce returns business, that has been on a mission to build the best retail returns and post-purchase solution since 2015. Today, hundreds of companies across 130 countries use the ZigZag platform to help reduce the cost, friction, and impact of returns.

We’re passionate about streamlining the returns and post-purchase experience for our clients and their customers. Helping our clients to become more sustainable and profitable in the process.

In March 2021, ZigZag was acquired by Global Blue, an industry leader in tax free shopping. Strengthening our reach across the global retail industry and allowing us to continue to do what we do best, help retailers manage and re-sell their returns.

We believe we have the chance to genuinely challenge and disrupt the industry, so come and join the ambitious and caring team determined to build the world’s most innovative, and helpful returns experience possible.

 

About the People Team

Our UK People team is newly formed and this role will be the second member of the team. We’re passionate about ensuring every employee at ZigZag has the best possible employee experience. We’re here to support employees – they’re our clients!

This is a great time to be joining the team as we’re in the process of building out all our processes and establishing the function. You’ll have the opportunity to help shape our processes, philosophies and culture.

Requirements

This role is part-time and the equivalent of 3 days (24 hours) a week and we're flexible about when those hours are worked throughout the week.

 

What you’ll be doing:

Employee Lifecycle

  • Manage all employee life-cycle processes including, onboarding, benefits, probation and offboarding
  • Ensure all right to work checks are completed and up to date
  • Issue all employee documentation, including contracts and amendment letters
  • Support the administration of company benefits
  • Support with the running of our review cycles, such a performance reviews and salary reviews
  • Support with employment relations cases and processes
  • Help to create and maintain all People & Culture policies and philosophies, touching on all aspects on the employee journey
  • Support with creating, rolling out and managing culture and culture change initiatives, ensuring we are being intentional about harnessing and preserving our great working culture as we grow

 

Support for Employees

  • Be the first point of contact for employees, providing day-to-day support for any queries or concerns they may have around pay, policies and process etc.
  • Listen to employees, collecting their feedback on culture and processes, suggesting ways in which we can improve based on these
  • Support employees in the visa application process
  • Constantly looking to improving our workflows and processes, making full use of our HRIS and other tools to help automate processes
  • Build and produce reports to keep track of people metrics
  • Produce and upload reports for salary benchmarking

 

People Data and Reporting

  • Maintain our HRIS, HiBoB ensuring our is always up to date and employees files and documentation
  • Constantly looking to improving our workflows and processes, making full use of our HRIS and other tools to help automate processes
  • Produce and upload reports for salary benchmarking
  • Build and produce reports to keep track of people metrics
  •  
  •  

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • 1-2 years previous experience in HR or People Ops
  • Genuinely care about people and their employment experience
  • Ability to take initiative, be autonomous and get stuff done
  • A positive and solution focused approach to problem solving
  • Ability to work well with ambiguity and turn ideas into practical processes and clear philosophies
  • Emotional intelligence and the ability to treat difficult conversations and sensitive situations with care
  • A sincere and professional approach, always being honest, ethical and fair
  • Great communication skills – one of our key roles as people team is to build trust and deliver clear and consistent messaging to employees of all levels

Benefits

  • 24 days holidays + bank holidays + additional day holiday after every full year of service (up to 5 additional days)
  • Flexible work options – fully remote or hybrid options – depending on your location (our office hub is in London)
  • Flexible working hours – to provide work life balance
  • Pension Plan
  • BUPA Private Medical Insurance
  • Employee referral bonus scheme

results.title: Enterprise Software Sales Consultant
results.description:
Company Description

This is a unique opportunity to get on executive team of a fast-growing AI start-up. The company is founded by a Stanford professor and led by recognized thought leaders in Industrial AI and aerospace analytics.

Our main product is enterprise SaaS for maintenance supply chain in aircraft fleets. The product is built around proprietary Analytics Engines and allows easy customer data integrations.

The company won substantial repeat business from US Air Force Sustainment Operations over last several years. We looking to leverage our military customer successes into substantial growth in the short term, and an M&A exit in the medium term (a couple of years). We are a technology leader in a fast-growing segment of Industrial AI for supply chain and the probability of fast win is very high.



Job Description

We are looking for a Sales Executive with strong experience selling enterprise software in the Aviation/ Airlines industry directly and through partnerships/channels. In addition to Aviation/ Airlines, your clients may have included aerospace OEMs, MRO companies, IT vendors who sell to aerospace, etc.

You will be working with C-level executives of the clients and partners, as well as with our leadership team and be responsible for negotiating complex agreements, closing deals, and growing accounts.



Qualifications
  • At least 5 years of experience selling enterprise software in the Aviation/ Airlines industry including major accounts sales.
  • Proven experience closing deals larger than $1-2M.
  • Experience working with C-level leaders
  • Experience with AI or Advanced Analytics business.
  • Experience or strong interest in working at a start-up company and sharing its success
  • Experience with M&A deals is a plus.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree.
  • US Citizenship
  • Ability to travel as needed


Additional Information
  • All candidates must be US Citizens.
  • This is a part-time position (hourly rate plus generous commissions)
  • This is a remote position. You can live anywhere in the USA. Proximity to San Francisco Bay Area or Atlanta, GA is a plus.

results.title: Fractional Content Marketing Consultant
results.description:
We are looking for a talented Content marketing consultant (fractional) to lead our inbound marketing strategies including social media, blogs and lead generation.

Our ideal candidate is a creative marketing professional, preferably with a writing background. You should be able to develop engaging content to attract and retain customers. For this position, it's also essential to be up-to-date with new technologies and marketing trends.

Ultimately, you should be able to expand our company's digital footprint and brand awareness.

Responsibilities:

Content leadership

  • Understanding the company's sales vision, and mapping it with its target audience through customer profiling.
  • Design content marketing strategies and set short-term goals
  • Design outbound strategies (Email, Linkedin, Webinars etc), keeping company's sales goals in mind.
  • Help the organization with employer branding

Deliverables:

  • Create key content pieces yourself for the website's Home page and key landing pages
  • Develop crisp Linkedin campaigns and outbound email series and create copies, and do A/B testing
  • Develop editorial calendar, delegate tasks, and ensure deadlines are met
  • Deliver engaging content on a regular basis and inspire team members
  • Edit, proofread and improve content

Requirements and skills

  • Proven work experience as a Content marketing manager
  • Previous portfolio of similar domains ( Software outsourcing and Remote IT staffing solutions).
  • Understanding of web publishing requirements
  • Editorial mindset with an ability to predict audience preferences
  • Hands on experience with SEO and web traffic metrics
  • Expertise in social media platforms
  • Project management skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication and writing skills in English

This role has potential to become full time. In this role, you will conceptualize, design and execute prototypes using brand design elements such as shape, color, graphics and typography to create packaging that is functional and appealing to our customers.

This role will be responsible for drawing the customer's attention while relaying important information and giving the item its purchasing power. Besides having savvy design skills, collaboration is key as you will work closely with Design and Product Development teams to ensure the company's product and brand are well represented through the packaging materials. In this role, you will create prototypes for e-commerce and marketing materials and will team up with product development, supply chain coordinators, and regulatory stakeholders to ensure all needs are met.

Responsibilities:

  • Review drafts to secure quality and keep track of all creative process steps

  • Strong understanding of, and experience with file organization including version tracking and revision history

  • Review final copy, layouts, and content for digital and print forms prior to testing, delivery, and launch
  • Collaborates with product development and creative teams, especially graphic designers and copywriters, to create eye-catching designs

OnePet inspires our people at every level. We believe in investing and helping you at every step of your career and helping you identify and hone your unique strengths. We encourage you to grow by providing formal and informal development programs, coaching, and mentoring. We want you to ask questions, take chances, and explore impossible possibilities.

We are committed to an inclusive hiring process. If you feel you would be a strong fit for the role, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all the criteria listed below. 

The nitty gritty:

  • 2-4 years of relevant experience (HR consulting, HR generalist, or HR business partner preferred)
  • Minimum of 1 year of external consulting experience or other client-facing experience
  • Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree in related specialization area preferred
  • Demonstrated interest in HR profession through certifications (PHR/SPHR/SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP), coursework, professional organizations, conference attendance, etc.
  • Proficiency with HRIS and ATS systems; Workday and ADP proficiency preferred

  • Strong communication skills (oral and written), including the ability to create presentations/decks for external consumption and present complex information eloquently for variety of external stakeholders

The big picture:

  • Desire to be part of a high-performing and flexible team
  • Comfortable working independently in a fast-paced and flexible startup environment
  • Strong client and service delivery orientation; ability to manage multiple projects and client engagements at the same time
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and rolling up sleeves to solve problems creatively
  • Ability to maintain personal effectiveness from home and remain positively motivated under pressure
  • Strong research capabilities and project management skills
  • Successful record of building and maintaining trusted relationships with clients across the spectrum of seniority; ability to build relationships virtually (Zoom, Slack, over the phone, etc.)
  • Ability to gather, synthesize and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from stakeholder interviews, focus groups, employee surveys, or other sources
  • Strong commitment to driving an inclusive work environment and culture
  • Strong sense of professional ethics and accountability



Additional Information

Our Core Values

  • Great Results: We develop, design, and deliver tailored solutions that generate impactful outcomes and sustainable value.
  • Great Lives: We value self-care, family care, and community care above all else.
  • Greater Together: We’re inclusive and reflective, and we believe in the power of diverse teams. 

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Greater is absolutely and unequivocally committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in all aspects of our practice. We strive to build and sustain a diverse team and strongly encourage applications from candidates of color. 

Greater is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, gender or gender-identity, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or parental status, or any other basis prohibited by law and our core values.

results.title: Match Supervisors
results.description:
Role: 

As a Match Supervisor you will work with Match Analysis Operators in specific regions ensuring the highest sports data quality is collected from sports events. The role entails reviewing the official data collected by official Match Analysis Operators onsite, assuring its accuracy, and reacting if there are discrepancies. Occasionally, it may involve acting as a remote Match Analysis Operator in the event issues arise that prevent data being captured at the venue.

 

 

  • Responsibilities: 
    Ensure assignment of the events to Match Analysis Operators has been done with the required lead time in order to arrange the data collection schedules
  • Confirm Match Analysis Operator’s readiness to collect data with required lead time
  • Verification of the fixtures, work closely with content operations team
  • Pre-match data input
  • Main POC for Match Analysis Operators, assist with any problems onsite with data collection on match days and during testing phase of data collection tools and processes
  • Take over data collection remotely (from stream or over the phone) in case Match Analysis Operators cannot collect data onsite
  • Monitor and ensure the accuracy of in-play data captured by Match Analysis Operators from a few simultaneous matches, clarify data discrepancies
  • Ensure post-match deliveries from Match Analysis Operators are collected
  • Post-match review of collected data may also be required

  • At least 2 to 3 years of experience as a Manager/Supervisor of global (diverse) teams

  • Strong understanding of the structure of commercial live sports data, and of worldwide football leagues and competitions.

  • Substantial organising capacity and time management skills.

  • Ability to work under pressure and deliver results against KPIs.

  • Positive 'can-do' attitude and ability to communicate efficiently in a professional manner.

  • Proven track record of designing holistic workflows, translating them into processes, and supervising their successful execution.

  • Excellent communication skills, with mandatory fluent spoken and written English and French. Any additional language proficiency is a bonus.

 

Services:

  • Double-check assignment of the events to Match Analysis Operators has been done
  • with required lead time to all the matches you have been assigned to
  • Confirm Match Analysis Operator’s readiness to collect data with required lead time
  • Verification of the fixtures, work closely with content operations team
  • Pre-match data input may be required
  • Be the main POC for Match Analysis Operators during match and assist with any
  • problems onsite with data collection
  • Take over data collection remotely (from the live video stream or over the phone) in case
  • Match Analysis Operators cannot collect data onsite
  • Monitor and ensure the accuracy of in-play data captured by Match Analysis Operators from a few simultaneous matches and clarify data discrepancies
  • Ensure post-match deliveries from Match Analysis Operators are collected
  • Perform a post-match review of collected data
  • Carry out periodic reviews of the Match Analysis operator's performance may also be required
  • Place of work: Remotely
  • Requirements: computer, a stable internet connection (100 Mbps), web browser, mobile
  • phone with an active sim card (for phone and electronic means of communication)

What we offer:

  • Gross fee per match (including pre-match preparations, match supervision, post-match verifications)
  • Location: Europe

About Eleven Sports
ELEVEN is a global network of LIVE and non-live sport and entertainment content – from the world’s biggest sports events to the best longtail sport, to award-winning original programming.

The state of the art technology available via our newly launched global sports platform elevensports.com (previously MyCujoo.TV), which allows anyone to stream from a device as simple as a mobile phone, revolutionised football broadcasting. Our crazy idea to transform every single match into a live broadcast became the world's largest live football streaming platform. 

With an initial focus on niche-premium and longtail sports, our ambitions are now even bigger. In 2020 we also delivered our newest product, MyCujoo Live Services (MCLS), a highly scalable live streaming solution built on the tech stack powering ELEVEN Sports. Developed for rights owners in sports and beyond, MCLS equips content creators with the technology and tools to provide their fans with the most powerful, authentic, and engaging live streaming experiences.

results.title: Talent Researcher

Company Description

With the right tools, the right data, and a deep understanding of their organization, companies and institutions can build breakthrough teams.

Our journey began with launching PopShop in 2017, helping startups backed by the leading VCs recruit and retain top talent. What we found were companies racing to patch gaps in their headcount, burning cash just to try to keep pace with competitors.

We saw pervasive AI-washing in recruitment technology, biases reinforced by hiring algorithms, and missed opportunities to understand, at scale, lessons from the most pioneering companies; lessons that could be applied to our clients' unique organizational contexts.

Velocity isn't enough to compete anymore. Organizations need teams that can shorten the distance to innovation. That's why we’re building Haderak.
